main event: Two objects were observed falling to Earth from an unknown source in Bakersfield, California on March 5, 1948, trailing smoke. One object seemed to be on fire with red and black smoke.
interesting points: The objects were described as similar to falling aircraft., One object emitted red and black smoke as it fell., The sighting involved two observers from Pacific General Electric Company., There were attempts by searching parties and aircraft to locate the objects without success., The incident raised suspicion that the objects were not of astronomical origin.
sighted object: Two falling objects with smoke trailing
witness description: Employees of the Pacific General Electric Company
